intro: Rousseauxia marojejensis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy rousseauxia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
